item.description: Experimentation is a key element of Machine Learning Development. Differently, from most Software Development disciplines, Machine Learning relies on Intuition - Validation rather than on empiric tests to assess the behavior of a specific model.
item.content:encoded:
Machine Learning is a Data Science Process.

A few years ago, Drew Conway came up with and shared his now-ubiquitous Data Science Venn Diagram:

Data Science Venn Diagram — Drew Conway

As we can see, Data Science is the intersection of 3 disciplines, and Hacking Skills is just one part of it. So, it is different from Software Development for production.

Data Science Development is more like a creative research process. the term Science reminds us that Experiments is an important part of this process. Therefore, AI Labs are needed for these workflows.

“An experiment is a procedure carried out to support, refute, or validate a hypothesis. Experiments vary greatly in goal and scale, but always rely on repeatable procedure and logical analysis of the results.” — Wikipedia

Experimentation is a key element of Machine Learning Development. Differently, from most Software Development disciplines, Machine Learning relies on Intuition - Validation rather than on empiric tests to assess the behavior of a specific model.

For those of you that never worked on building an end-to-end Machine Learning AI Lab, I’d like to shed a light on this process.

item.content:encoded:
Data visualization plays vital roles in data science experiments and machine learning processes. Exploratory and explanatory data visualization helps us to create the thinking system, work on modeling the problem, construct a hypothesis, deliver insights, and more.

When incorporated into the data analysis process early and often, visualizations can even fundamentally alter the questions that someone is asking. The right visualization can help express a core idea or open space to examination; it can get the world talking about a dataset or sharing an insight. (1)

The truth is, there is plenty of room for artistry and creativity in data visualization. But success is built upon a linear process that encodes information for visual communication and subsequent decoding by wetware—the reader’s brain. (2)

item.title: Creative Intelligence
item.description: Creativity may be the ultimate moonshot for artificial intelligence. Already AI has helped write pop ballads, mimicked the styles of great painters and informed creative decisions in filmmaking. Experts wonder, however, how far AI can or should go in the creative process?
item.content:encoded:
Reading the press, you’d get the impression that AI is about to put humans out of work. In fact, the reality is that today’s AI is largely dependent on human intelligence to function. To ensure the success of your industrial AI projects, it’s critical to incorporate the knowledge of your employees and other humans in designing and training the systems, establishing best practices, and, once deployed, in managing, overseeing and correcting them.

Persian rugs are a testament to the ability and creativity of the artisans who craft them. The skills used in weaving these rugs have been passed from generation to generation. Just as each weaver is different, each handmade carpet is unique – no two are identical. (2) Photo: zollanvari.com

Silicon Valley won’t tell you this, but some of the most successful AI systems in production are hybrid AI systems. Hybrid AI seeks not to replace human labor, but to eliminate the most boring and repetitive aspects of it, allowing humans to spend more time on complex requests. Even looking to the future, a realistic scenario for many AI systems still anticipates significant human involvement, with humans handling perhaps the most complex 10% of requests.

Today there is a delusion that we can solve all the problems with AI. There is a big problem with this idea. Instead of supporting AI progress, it jeopardizes the value of machine intelligence by disregarding important AI safety principles and setting unrealistic expectations about what AI can do for humanity. (4)

Creativity may be the ultimate moonshot for artificial intelligence. Already AI has helped write pop ballads, mimicked the styles of great painters and informed creative decisions in filmmaking. Experts wonder, however, how far AI can or should go in the creative process? (1)

Technology moves fast forward, but “the essence of Life is creative intelligence. Out of creativity comes resilience—the ability to envision and find a new path. Creative intelligence is a quality that physicists increasingly believe is inherent in the universe. Inherent in Life. And thus inherent in us. This is what we need to solve today’s problems in a way that works for all Life.” (5)
